title: Aussie dollar just off three-year high after inflation surprise | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The ASX 200 has fallen slightly on Wednesday after disappointing inflation figures from Australia, increasing the likelihood of an interest rate hike when the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) meets next week. The Australian dollar retreated fractionally below 70 US cents after hitting three-year highs earlier in the day. title: Surprise spike in inflation adds pressure on RBA to raise interest rates | ABC NEWS
description: Australians are being warned to expect a hike to interest rates after a surprise jump in inflation. Price rises accelerated at the end of last year to push annual inflation to 3.8%, up from 3.4%. The hotter-than-expected result now has all four of the big banks unanimously tipping a rate increase from the RBA. title: March for Australia organiser's claim of 'bashing' by Middle Eastern men rejected | ABC NEWS
description: March for Australia claims its Gold Coast rally organiser was 'bashed' by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day. Queensland Police have rejected the claim, saying none involved in the altercation were of Middle Eastern descent. The viral post on March For Australia's official Facebook page fuelled hateful comments directed towards migrants and people of Middle Eastern descent. title: Health minister promises change after woman overdoses from stockpiled meds | ABC NEWS
description: Doctors could soon be forced to record all medicines they prescribe onto a national online database. The federal government is considering the move following the plight of a mother whose daughter died of an overdose. But the proposal is prompting questions about patient consent and privacy. National health reporter Stephanie Dalzell has this exclusive report. title: Albanese Government turns defence sights north with $355m RAAF base upgrade | ABC NEWS
description: Another upgrade to RAAF base Tindal has been unveiled, as the Albanese Government continues its push to "harden the north".   A new hangar was opened today for three unmanned, long-range surveillance drones, which will help patrol the maritime border at the flick of a button. James Elton has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Spain to grant around half a million undocumented migrants legal status | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Spain's government has announced it will grant legal status to hundreds of thousands of undocumented migrants and asylum seekers in a move that's defied rising anti-immigration sentiment worldwide. Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez described the decree as crucial for the economic growth of the country, though the decision has drawn criticism from far-right groups. International relations professor Alana Moceri tells The World the timing of the plan has drawn huge criticism. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Musk's X investigated by EU over Grok sexualised images after public outcry | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The European Commission has launched an investigation into social media platform X over sexually explicit images generated by its AI chatbot, Grok, including those depicting children. It follows similar crackdowns by countries like Indonesia and Malaysia, who have banned the platform due to concerns about a lack of appropriate safeguards. title: Trump, seeking damage control, weighs less aggressive approach in Minneapolis | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The fallout is continuing after a second fatal shooting in the US by immigration agents as the Trump administration faces criticism from both sides of the political divide. The controversial border patrol commander Greg Bovino has been pulled from the frontlines, and there are now calls by Democrats and some Republican senators for Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem to step down.
